body:
When I run:
 `./script/bootstrap.py --libcc_source_path=../libchromiumcontent/dist/main/src --libcc_shared_library_path=../libchromiumcontent/dist/main/shared_library --libcc_static_library_path=../libchromiumcontent/dist/main/static_library`

I get the following error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/romaincointepas/smartflix/electron/vendor/brightray/script/bootstrap", line 97, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/Users/romaincointepas/smartflix/electron/vendor/brightray/script/bootstrap", line 38, in main
    args.libcc_static_library_path)
  File "/Users/romaincointepas/smartflix/electron/vendor/brightray/script/bootstrap", line 85, in setup_libchromiumcontent
    subprocess.check_call([sys.executable, download, '-s'] + args)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 535, in check_call
    retcode = call(*popenargs, **kwargs)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 522, in call
    return Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs).wait()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 710, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1335, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
TypeError: execv() arg 2 must contain only strings

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./script/bootstrap.py", line 233, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "./script/bootstrap.py", line 63, in main
    args.libcc_static_library_path)
  File "./script/bootstrap.py", line 144, in bootstrap_brightray
    execute_stdout([sys.executable, bootstrap] + args)
  File "/Users/romaincointepas/smartflix/electron/script/lib/util.py", line 178, in execute_stdout
    execute(argv, env)
  File "/Users/romaincointepas/smartflix/electron/script/lib/util.py", line 166, in execute
    raise e
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['/usr/bin/python', '/Users/romaincointepas/smartflix/electron/vendor/brightray/script/bootstrap', '--commit', '464aff2398f619b1d4d91b9187de69803919dca2', '--target_arch', 'x64', 'http://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/libchromiumcontent', '--libcc_source_path', '../libchromiumcontent/dist/main/src', '--libcc_shared_library_path', '../libchromiumcontent/dist/main/shared_library', '--libcc_static_library_path', '../libchromiumcontent/dist/main/static_library']' returned non-zero exit status 1
```

Not sure about the error but what seems weird is that it is still calling the brightray bootstrap script with a commit hash and the URL?

PS: I'm not confident that the command I'm running is the correct one (I guessed it from the commit but I'm pretty new to this).

Can you please try the (change) [https://github.com/tejaspathak/brightray/commit/d4a9d15d054ebcea03f34a865417d5f009ffc4b9]
and let us know ?

Same error :/

I'm on OS X 10.11.1 with Xcode 7.1.1.

I'm using master of each repo (with a merge of recent commits from libchromiumcontent/master to its atom branch).

Did I use the new arguments correctly and pointed to the right folder? (I assume libcc source is dist/main/src, not libchromiumcontent repo?)

The change which i mentioned above [tejaspathak/brightray@d4a9d15] is not merged to main repo yet. I have generated pull request [https://github.com/atom/brightray/pull/174]  for it now. That should solve the below error that you are getting:

```
TypeError: execv() arg 2 must contain only strings
```

pls make sure that you have manually applied above change or wait till it gets merged. libcc_source_path is the directory having component directory base, chrome, url, v8 etc. 

The way I tested it was...
1. Get the libchromiumcontent automatically without passing above options to bootstrap. 
2. Copy the directory electron/vendor/brightray/vendor/download/libchromiumcontent/ to lets say /Work/backup_libchromiumcontent
3. Get new clone of electron or clean the existing one.
4. Then pass foll. options to bootstrap. You might also want to pass -v for verbose messages

```
--libcc_source_path=/Work/backup_libchromiumcontent/src --libcc_shared_library_path=/Work/backup_libchromiumcontent/shared_library --libcc_static_library_path=/Work/backup_libchromiumcontent/static_library 
```

Wow, sorry about that, it was late, I though it was merged already.

It fixed my problem, thanks!
